dynamic_line: What the hell?  What are you doing here?

responses.text: "The moonlit sky anoints the worthy, who seek The Path home."
Who are you?
What can you tell me about this place?
You are not alone in following The Path.
Ecce, sanguinem magum!  Impium profligatum!
[ATTACK] I'm here to kill you.
Er, I'll just be going.

dynamic_line.yes: Oh!  Sorry, didn't recognize you at fi- wait a minute…

responses.text: A former enemy taught me this secret.  We need not be enemies either.
There are many followers of The Path who still live.
We are not enemies.  Some of your own have joined us.
[ATTACK] …

dynamic_line: What, you expect us to just give up and join you, hunter?  When The Path has prepared us to survive in this ruined world, why would one of the shrikes defect to your cause?

responses.text: And why would a hunter complete the Dragonblood Sacrament?  We must all do what is necessary for humanity to survive.
They have seen that the error is not in The Path, but in using it for self-destructive reasons.
[ATTACK] I expect nothing but a quick death from you, sanguinist.

dynamic_line: As the shrikes have always done, seeking to defend our order.  But to join you?  I don't know what to think.  None of this has felt right, ever since the world ended.

responses.text: They entrusted us with knowledge collected by the other shrikes.  Come with me, and use what you've learned to make things right.
These people are beyond saving.  Find your own path, but leave this place.  Flee, and do not return.

dynamic_line: Bullshit.  You interrogated one of them to get that old code phrase, didn't you?  Probably killed them afterwards too.  Die, hunter!
So one of the shrikes sent you?  Have they strayed from The Path?  What is the meaning of this?

responses.text: Why not ask yourself why I'm standing here, having completed what your master is still trying to recreate?
They've saved valuable knowledge from destruction, and have made amends with the Cleaning Flame.  We don't have to fight either.
[ATTACK] …

dynamic_line: You're speaking of madness.  The Sanguine Order, and the Cleansing Flame, working together?  What common ground could we have, when their very existence is our anathema?

responses.text: They're found a way to work together.  You could do, make something better out of all this.
[ATTACK] Enough.  Time to die.

dynamic_line: Alright.  I believe you, it feels like we've been aimless ever since the apocalypse started.  But what could I even do?

responses.text: They sent me, come with me.  We can help you put what you've learned to good use.
Leave this place, find your own path, and don't look back.  Run.

dynamic_line: You must be either lost or crazy.  This place isn't safe, and you're not welcome here.  Leave, and forget this place even exists.

responses.text: I am a servant of He From Beyond The Veil.  We are not enemies.
You would not welcome a student of the arcane?
I can see you dabble in what I have already achieved.
[ATTACK] Try and stop me.
Okay, I'm going.

dynamic_line: Whatever old truce my masters had with yours, it died with the end of the world.  I'll let you go just this once.  Leave, and don't come back.  If the others found out I'm doing this, they'd kill me.

responses.text: [ATTACK] Then you'll die with them.
His will is greater than those you serve.  Stand aside.
Very well then.  Goodbye.

dynamic_line: Actually, my masters might find you useful, as a sacrifice if nothing else.  Die!
So you found what we seek?  My masters would be pleased to make use of your work, and your blood might make a useful sacrifice.

responses.text: If you turn me over to your master, what promise do you have that they'll share what they learn with you?
Consider your words more carefully.  You really think you can take me?

dynamic_line: I, well.  We've already benefited a bit from our own research.  Even if the master has practically bled us dry for every fragment of knowledge we earn.  This hasn't felt right anymore, ever since it all ended.  But what the hell am I supposed to do?  What are you even suggesting I do?

responses.text: Let them squabble and stab each other in the back, until they destroy themselves over scraps of arcane knowledge.  Join me and live.
They will simply kill you when you cease to be useful to them.  I'll at least let you escape with your life.  Go on, whelp.  Flee.
[ATTACK] You're pathetic.  You don't deserve to live.

dynamic_line: Maybe that's true.  But our unity under The Path has been broken.  It's survival of the strongest now, isn't it?  The magus here won't welcome another into the fold, you'll only be seen as a rival.

responses.text: Why are you here?
We don't have to fight.
[ATTACK] Then let the strong rule.  Die.

dynamic_line.yes: We continue our studies, in pursuit of survival.  The magus here is one of those who heard of the Dragonblood Sacrament, and decided that it was one valid option to draw power from Beyond and use it to survive.  And looking at you, it seems that method is indeed a valid one, isn't it?
dynamic_line.no: We continue our studies, in pursuit of survival.  There are many routes to it, and my master still believes that harnessing the power from Beyond might permit us to adapt to this world.

responses.text: And your master wants to recreate it?  We don't have to fight.
There are many ways to pursue The Path.  It doesn't have to end in us coming to blows.
[ATTACK] This must end, no matter our history.  Stand and fight.

dynamic_line: Indeed, I wish the magus would permit us to work together instead.  My master would greatly value what you've learned.  But you'd be considered a threat.

responses.text: Can you trust that your master will share the fruit of these studies with you?
[ATTACK] I'll show you and the others just how much of a threat I am.

dynamic_line.yes: I would rather we work together, use what you have learned for us to become stronger, together.  But my master will accept no rival in these trying times.  What am I to do?
dynamic_line.no: We shouldn't have to fight, ideally we would stand together in times like these.  Were we not destined to rule over the weak and undeserving?  But if my master will accept no rival, and better to stand with them than alone.

responses.text: I have succeeded where others have failed, pursuing the same method that your master seeks.  Can you really trust your master?.
Your master has erred in judgment.  They are not worthy of being followed.
[ATTACK] Then die, defending your misguided fool of a master.

dynamic_line: You're right.  This isn't the right way to follow The Path.  Would you take me in as an apprentice?

responses.text: Yes, join me.
[ATTACK] No.  You will face the same judgment as your master.

dynamic_line: And you think you're any more fit to rule in this dying world?  "Even those of great power, if laid low, may serve to better the victor."  Die!
What?  Oh shit…  no, not you!  Leave us alone, hunter!

responses.text: [ATTACK] Subire mortem tuam, sub malleo deorum!

dynamic_line: You don't just barge in here and expect to walk out without explaining yourself.  Why should I let you leave?

responses.text: I am a servant of He From Beyond The Veil.  There is no need for quarrel.
I am just a student of the arcane, seeking further knowledge.  I'll leave peacefully, honest.
Look at me.  I'm like you, there's no need for us to fight.
I didn't mean to intrude.  Sorry.  I'll just be going.
[ATTACK] Fuck you, I do what I want.

dynamic_line: Forget you ever saw anything here.  Before I change my mind.
Really?  How pathetic.  Your very presence endangers what we're working on.  I can't let you leave alive.

dynamic_line: It started in the cities, that much is clear.  That's why probably caught so many students of the Beyond off-guard.  Something in the water evidently, and my rough guess is that caused the rioting and undead at minimum.  No guesses beyond that, though.  I only knew a bit of the news due to having been fairly new to the Order.

responses.text: What does the Sanguine Order have to do with it?
<done_conversation_section>
<end_talking>

dynamic_line: The magi liked to isolate us from civilization at large.  Typical cult stuff now that I think about it, plus made it easier to cover our tracks.  But, for all the talk of preparation and adaptation, I don't know if they really predicted this, but our isolation kept us from suffering the same fate as those in the cities.  Now it's just a matter of surviving, I guess.

dynamic_line: I hadn't been in the Order for very long when one of the magi had everyone gathered up.  We were in this other place at the time with a couple others, and initially I thought she was preparing another lesson.

responses.text: Magi?
What happened?
<done_conversation_section>
<end_talking>

dynamic_line: There were a few, yeah.  The higher-rank blood mages, basically.  This was before the one at the hideout split off from the others, and led us into trying to scrounge up some old research.  Things were tense back then, but at least I felt like I could trust those higher up in rank to reward fair study…

responses.text: So what happened?
<done_conversation_section>
<end_talking>

dynamic_line: There was a shrike there, those were rather rare by the time I joined.  That's what they call the guys that specialize in killing mage hunters.  They'd passed a message of some sort to the lead magus, whatever it was got her all agitated.  Started ranting and raving about the end of the world and the dead coming back to life.  They'd talk about stuff like that before, but it seemed different this time.

responses.text: What seemed different about it?
<done_conversation_section>
<end_talking>

dynamic_line: At first it was just the same shit, only thing that seemed strange was talking about it like it had already happened.  Before they'd be all vague, talking about portents and omens of doom, but it wasn't until we moved on to the next hideout that most of us at the bottom of the totem pole figured out something went down…
